intro: Thesium tongolicum, commonly known as the Tongoli thesium, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are often mistaken for grasses due to their appearance. It thrives in moist, coastal environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Thesium tongolicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
